required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Exploratory Study of Ganglioside GM1 in Acute Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Ganglioside GM1 in Acute Ischemic Stroke: a Prospective, Randomized, Blinded Assessment of Endpoints, and Multicenter Exploratory Study

lead_sponsor.agency: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

collaborator.agency: The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

clinical_study.source: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and safety of higher doses of monosialoganglioside GM1 injection in the treatment of patients with acute ischemic stroke.

primary_outcome.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in National Institute of Health stroke scale
secondary_outcome.description: the minimum and maximum values of NIHSS are 0 and 42, respectively; higher NIHSS mean a worse outcome
the minimum and maximum values of BI are 0 and 100, respectively; higher BI mean a good outcome

other_outcome.description: The change of infarct volume showed by MRI compared with baseline

intervention.description: Monosialoganglioside GM1 diluted with 0.9% normal saline 100ml, iv, daily for 12-14 days

overall_official.affiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

facility.name: General Hospital of ShenYang Military Region

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region
